author: Karthik Madhavan
text:
Overhauling of effluent treatment plants at existing slaughter houses too is affected

The future of the Coimbatore Corporation’s abattoir modernisation project is uncertain as the Union Government has said that it has no funds.

The corporation had planned to modernise four abattoirs and build two more to provide a more hygienic environment.

The corporation is managing slaughter houses in Ganapathy, Ukkadam, Podanur, and Uppilipalayam.

New abattoirs

It proposed two more abattoirs in Thudiyalur and Ukkadam for which it approached the Union Government’s National Meat and Poultry Processing Board for funds in 2013.

A final proposal was sent in February 2015, after clarifying queries from the Board, and incorporating suggestions from the State Government.

It proposed a Rs.-17 crore unit in Thudiyalur with a capacity to slaughter 1,500 animals and 4,000 birds a day . It also proposed a new cattle slaughtering facility in Ukkadam at Rs. 14.74 crore with the capacity to deal with 300 animals a day.

And Rs 56 crore for modernising the existing facilities.

Sources said that the corporation had planned to use the funds to modernise and strengthen the effluent treatment plants attached to the existing slaughter houses.

At the time of submitting the proposal, the corporation expected 50 per cent of the total project cost from the Union Government and 25 per cent from the Tamil Nadu Government.

PPP mode

After the Union Government cited shortage of funds and backed out, the civic body tried the public-private partnership mode, the sources said. Now in the absence of funds, the corporation had more or less shelved the project, they added.
title: No funds to modernise abattoirs
